intro: Smithia capitulifera, commonly known as the alpine snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, adapted to withstand harsh mountain climates. The flowers, which are usually white or pale blue, bloom in early summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
